title: How to install wifi driver on Windows 7 - Quora

response.answer_text: Most desktop PCs do not come with a wireless adapter. Nearly any laptop made in the last 15 years has one already installed and they are not easily replaced due to restrictions the manufactures place on them but can be bypassed with a USB version. Usually you install the physical adapter then… Install the driver from the CD included with the adapter orInstall the driver downloaded from the Internet (either while the wired Internet is connected or put onto a thumb-drive from another Internet connected computer.)In some cases you must install the driver first before installing the adapter. Best bet is to find the instructions for the exact model of adapter you are installing (in the package or from the manufacturer’s website). If you are purchasing an adapter make sure the model (PCIe or USB) is compatible with your OS (Windows 7 in your case).

Figure out what WiFi card you have. Usually looking under Device Manager under the Network section will give you this info.Go to your favorite search engine and search “{Your WiFi card} drivers Windows 7”Click on the result that is from the website for the company that made your WiFi card.Download the driver installer for Windows 7.Run the installer when it is finished.Rebooting your computer may not be necessary, but may be a good idea.Set up your WiFi network for use.Success!
